subject: NFL
event:
I am about halfway through watching the football games that were TIVO'd for me while I was overseas.

I came back from my trip sick to my stomach, as I reported last post.  These games are only making me sicker.

Life is meaningless and has no joy but the Raiders.

comments.article: But that Raiders joy was something to behold. ;-)
comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: boom headshot

comments.article: Don't despair! There's always light at the end of the tunnel (sometimes it's an oncoming train, yes, but...)

Oh how much I have resisted the temptation to tell you that you could look forward to two games at least. Spoilers you know.

Hope you enjoyed yourself over on this side of the Atlantic. I couldn't make any of the signings, but non-too-subtle hints to my wife along the lines of "Isn't Jack Vance a great author?", "Ooh, that's interesting, you can get signed copies of the Jack Vance tribute anthology online..." and "Not long until Christmas now..." have resulted in a promising looking Forbidden Planet plastic bag appearing under the bed!
My sympathies - while my team won, they have been mediocre/bad for so long before this season that I understand completely the crush of teamfail.

But the Rams won!

Once.
My condolences that you have to watch the Jets tank yet again.
WOOHOO! When the pats take out the fish AFC East is ours! Bring on the Colts in the playoffs...we want a rematch.
comments.subject: Umm...

comments.article: Expect no pity from a Dolphins fan!  Every Jets loss is like a beautiful new sunrise to me!!
comments.subject: No Pity

comments.article: Maybe you'd like to own a football team; us Redskins fans sure wouldn't mind seeing ANYBODY else run that organization.

This probably won't mean a lot to you Americans, but it's Saskatchewan Roughriders against Allouettes de Montreal this year for the Grey Cup. Go RIDERS! On a hockey note; can anyone believe how well the Coyotes are doing this year? Crazy. Hope you feel better soon, Ser Martin!
comments.subject: Grey Cup

comments.upictitle: Simon Roberts: My Equally Valid Opinion
comments.article: Woo!  Rider pride!  Though honestly I won't begrudge the Als if they get a win, they deserve a second Cup after being the most dominant team of the decade.  So there's really no way I can feel bad after this one.  :D
comments.subject: Re: Grey Cup

comments.article: On the plus side, having more than one team to root for means that at least one of them is doing well at your present point in time? (I don't actually know how they've been doing, too many other things to do, so don't take this to mean they are about to take a downturn).
You sound like a Browns fan ;)
The Chiefs WON!  Hey, it was bound to happen someday.
Welcome back Mr. Martin
As a lifelong Buffalo Bills fan, I feel your pain.
As a Denver Broncos fan--I feel your pain.

As a San Diego Charger fan -- your pain gives me life.

Go Giants!
The Chiefs!
comments.subject: And

comments.article: Broncos versus Giants. It should be the best Thursday game we've had in a while because of the desperation for both clubs. But maybe the Giants will be disinterested because of the short week and long trip. Denver can only hope, eh?

How in the world, in this day and age, do you avoid 'accidentally' discovering the outcome of the games throughout the week(s)? I usually DVR games and start them about halfway through (to skip the help your boner, pointlessly big trucks, and excessive bad beer commercials); and even then someone or something seems to ruin some part of the game! Your ability to disconnect should be heralded (or frowned upon?).
Since you said you're halfway through, you should have by now gotten to the SD v NYG game...if not, stop reading..........ok, are we clear now?... Being an SD fan, mwa ha ha ha! But as a football fan, you just HAVE to punch it in there when the team gives you a T/O in the red zone...the Chargers didn't win that one, NY gave it away (early Christmas for me!). Take care and get better George!
comments.subject: How?

comments.article: Would you hate me if I told you I got a sick pleasure out of watching the Jets lose?
Yes.

Frankly I'm amazed that you were able to fend off some schlep telling you or overhearing scores all this time.

It did cross my mind a few times that you were not going to get the happy welcome home from your gia-ets, but don't feel too bad - you still have a good chance at watching some meaningful January football and Rex Ryan is going to make that franchise a better one soon.
Well, I was in Morocco for half the trip.  The NFL is not big in Marrakesh.  I did hear plenty about Morocco's loss to Cameroons in soccer.
Hope you feel better. Happy Thanksgiving. Go Giants!
c'mon, become a pats fan. Its much better over here.
I will never yield to the dark side.

You're actually very fortunate because later in the season you have the privilege of rooting for the underdog and watch them make a legendary comeback which everyone knows is the most fun.  Hope you feel better.  (is now the time to mention that a vegan diet is best?)
Go Skins!

Finished watching the last few of my TIVO'd games.

A damn good thing the Giants pulled out that win over Atlanta in OT. If they had lost that one, I think I might have slit my wrists, and you guys would never have learned how Ice & Fire ends. The talking heads keep going on about how the G-Men have the top ranked defense in the league, but I honestly don't understand how that can be. I just watched them lose games to the Cardinals and Chargers, and let the Falcons tie it up, all late in the fouthr quarter when one big stop would have won the game. The Giants D of old would have shut those teams down and closed out the win.

As for the Jets... sigh...

For anyone who wonders why all right-thinking football fans despise Evil Little Bill, I submit as evidence the end of the Pats-Jets game. With 30 secords left on the clock, and the Pats ahead 31-14, Lil' Bill calls a bomb to Randy Moss. It fell incomplete, but that's not the point. Running up the score in that situation is absolutely without class. Was Vile Lil' Bill afraid Gang Green would unleash their patented 18-point scoring play in the last ten seconds?

The Patriots are a great team and Brady is a great QB, but BB is a nasty piece of work.

Belichick doesn't call plays. That was a Brady read at the line that he called to Moss as an 'FU' to the talkative and talented Darrelle Revis.

You may have missed the chatter in the week leading up to the game, but he called out Moss in his Twitter and in interviews.
